item.title: Flutterwave buys Nigeria’s Mono in rare African fintech exit
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: Africa’s largest fintech company, Flutterwave, has acquired Nigerian open banking startup Mono in an all-stock deal valued between $25 million and $40 million, according to people familiar with the transaction. The acquisition brings together two of Africa’s leading fintech infrastructure companies. Flutterwave operates one of the continent’s widest payments networks, while Mono, often described as […]

item.title: Can a social app fix the ‘terrible devastation’ of social media?
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Twitter co-founder Biz Stone and Pinterest co-founder Evan Sharp have raised new funding for a social media app that helps users "plan with intention."

item.title: DoorDash says it banned driver who seemingly faked a delivery using AI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: DoorDash seems to have confirmed a viral story about a driver using an AI-generated photo to lie about making a delivery.

item.title: French and Malaysian authorities are investigating Grok for generating sexualized deepfakes
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: France and Malaysia have joined India in condemning Grok for creating sexualized deepfakes of women and minors.

item.title: Plaud launches a new AI pin and a desktop meeting notetaker
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Plaud is going after the likes of Granola to launch a desktop app that records online meetings

item.title: Subtle releases ear buds with its noise isolation models
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Subtle's new $199 earbuds will also let you dictate in any app on desktop or phone

item.title: Tech billionaires cashed out $16 billion in 2025 as stocks soared
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Jeff Bezos led the way. The Amazon founder sold 25 million shares for $5.7 billion in June and July, right around the time he was getting hitched to Lauren Sanchez in Venice.

item.title: California residents can use new tool to demand brokers delete their personal data
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: A new tool should make it easier for California residents to limit data brokers’ ability to store and sell their personal information.

item.title: Bitfinex hacker Ilya Lichtenstein credits Trump for early release from prison
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Ilya Lichtenstein, who pled guilty to money laundering charges tied to his role in the massive hack of crypto exchange Bitfinex, has apparently been released early from prison.

item.title: India orders Musk’s X to fix Grok over ‘obscene’ AI content
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: India's IT ministry has given X 72 hours to submit an action-taken report.

item.title: 10 useful gadgets for your first apartment
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: From home security systems and smart smoke detectors to a sunrise alarm gently that wakes you up, here are the must-have gadgets for living in your first apartment.

item.title: Tesla annual sales decline 9% as it’s overtaken by BYD as global EV leader
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Tesla annual sales have fallen for the second year in a row, a drop fueled by the removal of the federal tax credit in the U.S. and competition from Chinese automakers.

item.title: Nvidia’s AI empire: A look at its top startup investments
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Over the last two years, Nvidia has used its ballooning fortunes to invest in over 100 AI startups. Here are the giant semiconductor's largest investments.

item.title: The 16 top logistics, manufacturing, materials startups from Disrupt Startup Battlefield
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Here is the full list of the logistics, manufacturing, and materials Startup Battlefield 200 selectees, along with a note on what made us select them for the competition.

item.title: Pebble reboots its thinnest smartwatch with the Pebble Round 2
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Pebble launches a $199 smartwatch with rounded screen that can last up to 2 weeks on one charge.

item.title: In 2026, AI will move from hype to pragmatism
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: In 2026, here's what you can expect from the AI industry: new architectures, smaller models, world models, reliable agents, physical AI, and products designed for real-world use.

item.title: Clicks debuts its own take on the BlackBerry smartphone, plus a $79 snap-on mobile keyboard
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The company behind the add-on mobile keyboards with physical buttons is now doing its own phone.

item.title: Even as global crop prices fall, India’s Arya.ag is attracting investors — and staying profitable
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Arya.ag, an Indian agritech company offering storage facilities near farms and offering lending services to hundreds of thousands of farmers, has drawn investor interest and remained profitable even as global crop prices continue to fall in a volatile commodities market. The investor interest has taken shape in the latest all-equity Series D round from GEF […]

item.title: A guide to choosing the right Apple Watch
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The gap between Apple's standard and budget smart watches has never felt smaller.

item.title: A beginner’s guide to Mastodon, the open source Twitter alternative
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Unless if you’re really in the know about nascent platforms, you probably didn’t know what Mastodon was until Elon Musk bought Twitter and renamed it X. In the initial aftermath of the acquisition, as users fretted over what direction Twitter would take, millions of users hopped over to Mastodon, a fellow microblogging site. As time […]
